Are you running Ubuntu or what?
dapper on a intel core duo mac mini no less :)
goto System -> Preferences -> Sound and what do you see?
a dumbed down version of what used to be useful. Enable ESD (not ticked), Play sys sounds (not ticked), Default sound card: HDA Intel (my ALSA soundcard)
yeah it looks different than I remember. My esd box is ticked, so try that.
lol. then in terminal ps -A|grep esd and see if its running
if I tick it esd is running but not producing sound (that is normal, I never been able to get esd to play nice with any of my hardware). so now it's ticked off again :P
yeah, /dev/dsp exist. I appreciate your help but I will continue to hunt for a solution tomorrow, need some sleep. At least I know that the kernel modules are ok and that some apps get sound.
kitche, crimsun: /etc/asound.conf was not correct. pointed to use 'pcm "hw:0,1"' instead of the real deal "hw:0,0". now all apps get sound.
that was a looooong troubleshooting for such a small thing that should have been detected during install time.
file a bug if you would. Its probably because mac-minis aren't super-common
